msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

author.persName: Ṣāʼib Tabrīzī, Muḥammad ʻAlī, d. ca. 1670

msItem.title: A collection of the ghazals of Sa'ib.
msItem.note: F1a: note of ownership of Muhammad Hasib, dated 1[0?]95 (1683-4?). Last folio, recto: obscure impression of small rectangular seal. Last folio, verso: Two impressions of a large oval seal: Fadlallah talib-i faid-i amjad?, dated 1141 (1728-9) and regnal year 14. Inside front cover: armorial bookplate of Gordon of Buthlaw. Ruled headings and dividing panels. Panel of illumination over beginning of text.
msItem.incipit: Dar qulzum-i may hubab ast del-i ma

listBibl.bibl: General Gordon's bequest of books and Turkish, Perian and Arabic manuscripts is mentioned, without details in the donations register under November 6 1841. The bequest is mentioned in J.R.A.S., vii, 1843, Annual Report, p. x, and the manuscripts are briefly listed in the Proceedings, pp. xxx-xxxi.

layoutDesc.p: 16 lines to the page in double column

bindingDesc.p: Red leather British binding with tooled decoration.

acquisition.p: Bequest of General Thomas Gordon of Buthlaw.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
